column2: MAINE DMV PERMIT TEST
Question Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. If you remain in the back blind spot of a large vehicle:
column4: the large vehicle will take much longer to stop.
column6: you increase the chance of a crash.
column8: you can reduce fuel consumption.

column2: 2. This road sign means:
column8: Stop ahead

column2: 3. This road sign means:
column6: A left turn can be made only after stopping
column8: All traffic must turn right at the next intersection

column2: 4. You hear a siren close by but can not see where the emergency vehicle is. What do you do?
column4: Stop only if you are sure that the vehicle is headed toward you in the opposite lane.
column6: Keep driving until you are sure the emergency vehicle is headed toward you.
column8: Stop immediately and activate your emergency flashers.
column10: Pull over to the right side of the road and stop until you are sure the emergency vehicle is not headed toward you.

column2: 5. Which of the following must you obey over the others?
column8: Stop sign

column2: 6. When a pedestrian carrying a white cane is at the corner ready to cross the street in front of you, before making your right turn, you should:
column4: turn off the ignition until the person crosses the street.
column6: use your horn to help the pedestrian cross the street.
column8: tell the pedestrian where to cross the street.
column10: yield the right-of-way and wait until the pedestrian crosses the street.

column2: 7. When passing another vehicle, you should:
column6: check your mirrors and blind spots.
column8: drive at the same speed as the vehicle you are passing.
column10: assume the other vehicle will maintain a constant speed.

column2: 8. Construction zone signs are generally:
column6: diamond or rectangular with orange and black coloring.
column8: triangular with black and yellow coloring.

column2: 9. Drivers under 21 years of age are considered to be driving under the influence if their blood alcohol concentration (BAC) is:
column8: .02% or higher.

column2: 10. If you drive much slower than the posted speed limit you:
column4: always have the right of way.
column8: are driving safely and can avoid tailgaters.

column2: 11. What should you do if your vision through the windshield becomes blocked?
column4: Pull your vehicle off the road and park it.
column6: Open the side window so you can see.
column8: Turn on your emergency lights.

column2: 12. This road sign means:
column8: No left turn

column2: 13. Motorists are not required to yield to pedestrians when approaching or exiting a roundabout.
14. What should drivers do in case of a brake failure?
column4: Tie a white cloth on the left door handle.
column8: Shift to a lower gear.

column2: 15. When you approach a railroad crossing, but you do not see a train. You must stop:
column4: if a crossing gate is lowered.
column6: if the crossing lights are flashing.
column8: if a stop sign is posted.

column2: 16. You have been involved in a minor traffic collision with a parked vehicle and you can't find the owner. You must:
column4: call your insurance company within 14 days.
column6: wait for the owner to return.
column8: leave a note on the vehicle and report the accident with no delay.

column2: 17. This road sign means:
column8: Side road

column2: 18. You reach an intersection that is not controlled at the same time as a driver on your right, and both of you prepare to go straight. Who has the right-of-way?
column8: The other driver.

column2: 19. When driving in a construction zone you should:
column8: come to a complete stop and check road conditions.

column2: 20. When you are involved in an accident, you should:
column8: stop immediately.

column2: 21. Blind spots around a large vehicle are _________________ than the blind spots around a car.
column8: less dangerous

column2: 22. Aggressive driving includes:
column6: quick lane changes without a signal.
column8: yelling, honking, gesturing at other drivers.

column2: 23. When driving in bad weather, drivers should:
column6: increase their speed to get to their destination more quickly.
column8: decrease the following distance.

column2: 24. What does a red arrow on a traffic light mean?
column4: You may turn in the direction of the arrow.
column6: You must stop. Do not go in the direction of the arrow until a green light or arrow light goes on.
column8: You may proceed slowly through the intersection.
column10: You must stop and then proceed when the way is clear.

column2: 25. This road sign indicates that:
column4: vehicles cannot go straight ahead. Cars must turn either to the right or left.
column6: a lane is reserved for certain purposes or certain vehicles.
column8: buses and car pools may not travel in the restricted lane.

column2: 26. To drive defensively you should:
column4: keep your eyes moving to look for possible hazards.
column6: always put one car length between you and the car ahead.
column8: look only at the car in front of you while driving.

column2: 27. Your vehicles braking distance will be much longer:
column6: on wet, icy or gravel roads.
column8: when driving at night.

column2: 28. This road sign means:
column8: Stop Sign Ahead

column2: 29. This road sign means:
column6: Look both ways before crossing the intersection
column8: Crossroads ahead

column2: 30. Blocking an intersection during rush hour traffic is not permitted:
column8: unless you entered the intersection on a green light.

column2: 31. It is legal to make a left turn at a red light after stopping if:
column4: you are traveling on a one-way street and turning onto another one-way street.
column6: you yield to all other traffic at the intersection before proceeding.
column8: you are traveling on a two-way street and turning onto a two-way street.

column2: 32. ABS is the acronym for:
column8: Average-Beam System

column2: 33. When driving on a roadway with a single broken white line:
column4: you may change lanes only if you are in the right lane.
column6: you may not cross the broken white line.
column8: you may cross the broken white line to change lanes.

column2: 34. Drivers should always look carefully for motorcycles before changing lanes because:
column4: motorcycles are not permitted to share traffic lanes.
column6: motorcycles are smaller and harder to see.
column8: motorcycles always have the right-of-way at intersections.

column2: 35. When you back up:
column4: you should rely only on your rearview mirror.
column6: do it as fast as possible.
column8: always look through the rear window.

column2: 36. This sign means:
column4: Drivers will soon be on a roadway with two-way traffic.
column8: Keep to the left.

column2: 37. If your car becomes disabled on a highway, you should:
column8: park with all four wheels off the highway, if possible.

column2: 38. As you enter a roundabout you should slow down and:
column4: yield to pedestrians and bicyclist crossing before entering the roundabout.
column6: yield to any vehicle coming from your left in the roundabout.
column8: All of the above.

column2: 39. If a tire suddenly goes flat while you are driving, you should:
column4: slow down gradually do not apply the brake.
column6: pump the brake pedal 5-7 times until the vehicle stops.
column8: apply the brake firmly and stop.

column2: 40. To drive defensively, you must:
column8: keep one hand on the steering wheel.
column10: use the vehicle ahead as your only points of focus.

column2: 41. When driving at night, drivers should:
column6: look directly into the oncoming headlights of approaching vehicles.
column8: increase their following distance.

column2: 42. On roadways, bicyclists are considered:
column8: vehicles.

column2: 43. Speed limit signs are:
column8: service signs

column2: 44. Roads with double solid yellow lines in the center indicate that passing is:
column4: allowed only in your direction of travel.
column8: not allowed in either direction.

column2: 45. A solid yellow line next to a broken yellow line means that vehicles:
column4: next to the solid line may pass.
column8: next to the broken line may pass.

column2: 46. You have stopped for a train at a railroad crossing. After the train passes, you must:
column4: look to see if another train is coming, then cross the tracks if it is safe to do so.
column6: watch for vehicles that must stop at railroad crossings (school buses, vehicles carrying hazardous materials, etc.).
column8: All of the above.

column2: 47. On slippery roads, drivers should:
column8: increase their speed to avoid hydroplaning.
column10: leave more space in front of their vehicle.

column2: 48. Select the most effective safety restraint(s) in a traffic crash.
column4: A combination of lap/shoulder belt and air bag.
column8: Pumping brakes.

column2: 49. When driving behind a motorcycle, drivers must:
column4: pass the motorcycle in the same lane.
column6: remembers that motorcyclists have the right to use a complete traffic lane.
column8: drive on the shoulder beside the motorcycle.
column10: share the lane with the motorcycle.

column2: 50. This road sign means:
column8: No right turn

column2: 51. When driving at night with no other vehicles ahead, a driver should use:
column8: high beam lights.

column2: 52. The effect that alcohol has on your judgment:
column4: is less if you were only drinking wine.
column6: is less if you were only drinking beer.
column8: is greater if you were drinking hard liquor.
column10: depends on the amount of alcohol in your blood.

column2: 53. Distracted driving:
column4: causes the driver to react more slowly to hazards.
column6: usually causes the driver to drive slower.
column8: is never dangerous.
column10: is only dangerous for inexperienced drivers.

column2: 54. You arrive at an intersection where you have a green light, but the path ahead is blocked, you should:
column4: stay out of the intersection until traffic clears.
column6: enter the intersection and wait until traffic clears.
column8: turn left and find another route.
column10: merge into another lane and try to go around the traffic.

column2: 55. When you get in a car to drive, the first thing you should do is:
column8: adjust your seat belt.

column2: 56. If it safe to do so, you can pass a vehicle ahead when:
column4: you are on a hill or curve.
column6: there is a solid line on your side of the road.
column8: there is a broken line on your side of the road.

column2: 57. On slippery roads, drivers should:
column8: increase their speed to avoid hydroplaning.

column2: 58. This road sign means:
column8: You must turn left ahead

column2: 59. If you encounter an aggressive driver you should:
column8: show them how to drive defensively.

column2: 60. A flashing red traffic light:
column4: is used to indicate a pedestrian crossing.
column6: indicates that you should drive with caution.
column8: has the same meaning as a stop sign.
column10: has the same meaning as a yield sign.
